intro: Biota intermedia, commonly known as the common biota, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and open fields. Biota intermedia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
